ovdesc.p: The SWAP.BALANCES file records all financial movements and balance details of a particular Swap contract (including all balance information, principal outstanding, accruals, interest paid/received, rate changes, etc.).
Both current and historical details are maintained providing a means by which the system can control and record all financial transactions.
This file also provides a valuable source of information for enquiry and reporting purposes for both bank and customer requirements.
The file is keyed by contract number and leg identifier (asset or liability).

Two SWAP.BALANCES records, Asset and Liability, are created whenever a Swap contract is entered into the system and remain there as long as the contract remains "Live". Eg. SW9503000001.A and SW9503000001.L

The file is updated automatically by any Swap routines which modify any balance details. There is no facility for direct input to this file. The only functions that users are allowed to perform are "L"ist, "S"ee, and "P"rint.

A corresponding save file and history file exist, namely SWAP.BALANCES.SAVE and SWAP.BALANCES.HIST, which will be a copy of the data held in the SWAP.BALANCES file. The save file stores the last authorised version of the balances record whereas the history file stores the reversed version.
Whenever a Swap schedule is processed on the Swap contract, it is removed from the contract and it's details held on the relevant SWAP.BALANCES record.
The following associated information is held on this file :

o Currency of the leg. o Indication as to whether the principal is NOTIONAL or not. o Outstanding principal details. o Effective and historical interest rates. o Interest amounts and accrual details. o Amortisation details. o Schedules processed details. o Corresponding CRB details.
